intro: Rudgea crassipetiolata, commonly known as the broad-leafed rudgea, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the Malvaceae family and is characterized by its large, palmately lobed leaves. The plant produces showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that are typically pink or purple in color. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in forested areas. Due to its ornamental value, it is cultivated in gardens and botanical collections.
